meanings.definition: The quality or state of being allegorical.
meanings.sent1: The allegoricalness of the story made it easy to understand deeper meanings.
meanings.sent2: The writer's allegoricalness added layers of symbolism to the novel.
meanings.sent3: The allegoricalness of the fable made the moral lesson clear to all.
meanings.sent4: Her allegoricalness in storytelling painted vivid pictures in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The allegoricalness of the painting left a lasting impression on the viewers.

meanings.definition: The use of allegory in a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The allegoricalness of the poem enhanced its impact on the readers.
meanings.sent2: In his writing, the author's allegoricalness was evident in every chapter.
meanings.sent3: The allegoricalness of the play added a touch of mystery to the storyline.
meanings.sent4: The allegoricalness of the novel created a rich tapestry of hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: Her allegoricalness in storytelling captivated the audience's imagination.
